name: Ginger Spiced Molasses Sugar Cookies
description: Baked for the 2010 Serious Eats Cookie Swap by Katie Quinn, former SE intern Recipe from Food52...

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ground ginger, allspice, salt and cloves in bowl and mix well.
Beat butter and sugar together in bowl of electric mixer until light and fluffy, 3 minutes.
Add egg and molasses. Mix to combine well. Stir in dry ingredients. Stir in candied ginger if using. Refrigerate batter 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Roll dough into 1 1/2" balls. Roll balls in granulated sugar. Arrange on baking sheets lined with parchment paper. Bake in oven until set and crinkled on top, about 12 minutes. Remove and cool.
